title: US blizzard 2016 - as it happened - BBC News
summary: a travel ban on cars in new york city has ended .
air travel in the us is still severely disrupted and the washington dc metro remains closed .
people have been digging themselves out of drifts up to 40in ( 102cm ) deep .
at least six deaths have been reported in incidents related to shovelling snow .
a further 12 people have died in other snow-related incidents since friday .

documents.title: thanks for being with us
text: that 's it for our live updates on the snowstorm .
you can follow future developments on the story here .

documents.title: please do n't dig , says nyc mayor
text: new york city mayor bill de blasio has urged drivers not to try digging their cars out .
he wants people to leave cars where they are , fearful they will shovel snow from their cars back on to the freshly cleared streets .
the city has suspended some parking rules to help with this , but the mayor 's office said 25 summonses had been issued to people who ignored saturday 's travel ban .

documents.title: washington before and after the blizzard
text: the washington post has done a clever visual story about the blizzard , showing dc 's iconic landmarks - before and after .

documents.title: do n't forget delaware - evacuations and flooding
text: with all the talk of nyc and washington , it 's easy to forget the places that do n't often get the headlines .

delaware governor jack markell has lifted a driving ban but urged drivers to stay off the roads fifty people were evacuated from oak orchard in sussex county on saturday and flooding remains a concern .

documents.title: schools closed on monday
text: expect more in the coming days on how nyc reopened but washington dc remained closed for business - no metro today and no schools tomorrow .

documents.title: home theatres are the only theatres in washington
text: home theatres are the only theatres in washington

documents.title: the eye of the storm , with more than a metre of snow
text: parts of west virginia , west of washington dc , topped 40ins ( 102cm ) , as our map shows .

documents.title: snowboarding through manhattan
text: new york-based youtube vlogger casey neistat used saturday 's snowfall as an excuse for some extreme sports and extreme filming .

documents.title: the show does go on - broadway returns
text: saturday 's record-breaking snowfall and the travel ban that followed saw all matinee and evening performances on broadway cancelled .
but business on new york 's great white way will return to normal on sunday , with both matinees and evening performances given the green light .
`` the show must go on , '' said charlotte st martin , president of the broadway league .
`` we do n't want to disappoint the large percentage of our audience who come in from out of town . ''
here 's how one broadway performer spread the news to her twitter followers .
author: Neil Smith
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: low pressure + jet stream = lots of snow
text: if you 're wondering why this storm was so `` snowy '' , mashable attempts to explain
first and foremost , there was an upper level low pressure area that dug a deep dip , or trough , in the jet stream across the southeast .
the circulation around this low and the jet stream winds associated with it produced an area of strong lift in the atmosphere out ahead of it .

this helped trigger a surface low pressure area , which strengthened rapidly on friday night and saturday morning as it moved up the coast to a position east of the delaware shoreline by midday saturday .
the upper low aligned itself on top of the low at the surface , creating a vertically stacked , whirling vortex off the east coast that sat and spun like a top throughout the day on saturday .

documents.title: new york subway staff worked overnight to clear snow , the mta says
text: here 's the latest on new york city subway services .
full details on the mta alert page .
subway service has been restored to portions of the above ground network hit hardest by this weekend 's record snowfall .
service will be limited as we ramp up and continue with snow removal operations .
this restoration was made possible by crews who worked overnight to clear snow and ice from rails , signals and switches .
some outages remain as crews , assisted by heavy duty snow equipment continue that work .

documents.title: new jersey governor chris christie holds news conference
text: governor christie will shortly hold a news conference .
the link to watch it is in his tweet below .

documents.title: the long island rail road remains out of action
text: in new york , the long island rail road service remains suspended until further notice .
officials say many of the train company 's yards are buried in more than two feet of snow .
tracks are also blocked by stranded trains .
the aim is to bring back service in time for the monday morning rush hour .

documents.title: did washington get more snow than we think ?
text: the washington post is questioning whether snowfall levels have been under-measured in the area and perhaps the storm was actually one of the top three recorded , rather than joint fourth .

documents.title: it 's been fun in new york , although the city 's been eerily quiet , says broadcaster alvin hall
text: it 's been really fun actually .
the snow was pretty deep .
i went for a walk in the middle of the snow storm , and the streets were full of people out walking their dogs , enjoying the snow .
it was really quite great to see .
although the city was eerily quiet - it was like being in a science fiction film , and you expect that we were the last people on earth .

documents.title: snowfall also breaks records in new york city
text: by the time the snow stopped falling late on saturday , new york 's central park had received 26.8in , the second biggest fall recorded since 1869 and just shy of the previous high , 26.9in , recorded in february 2006 .

documents.title: what 's happened so far
text: millions of people are waking up to piles of snow across the eastern part of the us .
the massive blizzard dubbed snowmageddon and snowzilla on social media , is now lessening and heading for the atlantic ocean .
it has affected about 85 million people and cut power to more than 200,000 homes .

documents.title: welcome to our snowstorms live page
text: welcome to the bbc 's us snowstorms live page .
we 'll be keeping you up to date with all the latest news , weather and travel information .
you can also read our main news story here and the bbc 's breaking news twitter feed here .
